text: Working well, helped them to raise money and focus on HL, they are still building

https://paragraph.com/@keyringnetwork/defi-curation-estimating-liquidation-size

Found some stuff about defi liquidations: measured and modelled more things than a Vogue catalogue.

some things already posted here eg. wierd liquidator preferences.
+ some new things.

Average liquidation size is ~ constant at $6k no matter what size of pool. Max liquidation sizes scale a bit with pool depth as you'd imagine...

As a rule of thumb it's pretty safe (99% certain) to assume single liquidations will be <$600k for pools <$1bn in size

For pools >$1bn, liqudations scale roughly as 6bps of the total depth
